properties.name: La Rinconada
properties.type: The highest permanent human settlement ○ 5,100 m (16,732 ft)
properties.location: Located in the Andes in Peru
properties.facts: The town is situated next to a gold mine, so the economy is mainly based on the extraction and production of gold, many artisanal. Between 2001 and 2009, the population increased to 30,000 people from just a small gold prospector camp because the price of gold rose 235% over that period.
properties.imageCopyright: Image by Hildegard Willer under CC BY-SA 4.0

properties.name: Point Nemo
properties.type: Most distant point from land ○ 2,688 km (1,670 mi) from the nearest land
properties.facts: The oceanic pole of inaccessibility was officially discovered in 1992 by survey engineer Hrvoje Lukatela. The pole has been nicknamed Point Nemo, after author Jules Verne's famous Captain Nemo. The name also means "no-one" in Latin, which is fitting because Point Nemo is so far from land, that the nearest humans are often astronauts. The International Space Station orbits the Earth at a maximum of 258 miles (416 km), meanwhile the nearest landmass is Ducie Island, an uninhabited atoll in the Pitcairn Islands, over 1,670 miles (2,700 km) away.
properties.imageCaption: Ducie Atoll, closest landmass to Point Nemo
properties.imageCopyright: Image by Angela K. Kepler under Public Domain
